attributes.action: Stop Members of Parliament from taking on additional jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Nurses = working 12-15 hour shifts
Teachers = working 60-70 hour weeks
Junior doctors = 50-100 hours a week

Members of Parliament, apparently able to work two or even three jobs.

There is something wrong with this picture.
attributes.background: MPs are paid £74,962 to represent constituents, serious questions should be asked of any MP who has time to take on an additional job. Either these MPs are not doing their job as our elected representatives properly, or the job role should be re-examined to justify the remuneration.
